nodes.bodyText: I have no idea why I would use this method. Please add some documentation explaining what this does with extra detail and when/why you would use it.

I agree, hopefully the documentation I added is understandable/enough.
When a built-in resource pack is registered, there's a new resource pack which is by default disabled like in the test mod I added for this module:

It also applies to data packs.
It can be very useful for some mods even if it's a bit specific but I prefer it being directly in FAPI than copying the ModNioResourcePack code and all the injections into each mods using built-in resource packs.
For example if a mod add "snowy" variations to blocks it can just add the snow layer into the integrated mod resource pack so it doesn't break the style when paired with user resource packs, but if the user uses the Default resource pack for example, the mod can provide a built-in resource pack with snowy textures based on the Default textures and limit style issues.
It can also be useful for data packs which could provide extra features but for some reasons should be optional.
Much better description
Drop the else half of the block and just return ModResourcePackUtil call
Is this boolean argument alwaysEnabled or pinned? I recall pack profiles have two boolean params and i forgot which one this is
